Column Comment.0: UNIQUE WELL IDENTIFIER: A unique name, code or number designated as theprimary key for this row.
Column Comment.1: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.2: CORE ID: Unique identifier for a well core
Column Comment.3: DESCRIPTION OBSERVATION NUMBER: A sequence number assigned to allowfor multiple core descriptions.
Column Comment.4: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.5: BASE DEPTH: Measured depth from the surface to the base of the describedinterval.
Column Comment.6: BASE DEPTH OUOM: Base measured depth original unit of measure.
Column Comment.7: BUSINESS ASSOCIATE: Unique identifier for a business associate, such as aperson, company, regulatory agency, government or consortium.
Column Comment.8: DESCRIPTION DATE: Date of the core description.
Column Comment.9: DIP ANGLE: The angle of inclination of bedding planes measured in a core.
Column Comment.10: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.11: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.12: INTERVAL THICKNESS: Measured bed thickness of the core for descriptionpurposes. This may be derived from the difference of the top and base depth.
Column Comment.13: INTERVAL THICKNESS OUOM: Thickness original unit of measure.
Column Comment.14: LITHOLOGY DESCRIPTION: Textual description of the core plug sample lithology.
Column Comment.15: POROSITY LENGTH: Total length of the cored interval analyzed for porosity.
Column Comment.16: POROSITY LENGTH OUOM: Porosity length original unit of measure.
Column Comment.17: QUALITY: A reference table describing standard quality indicators. For examplepoor, good, very good or excellent.
Column Comment.18: POROSITY TYPE: A description of the type of porosity observed. For exampleintergranular, sucrosic or cavernous.
Column Comment.19: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.20: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.21: SHOW LENGTH: That portion of the core interval, expressed as length, exhibiting theindicated quality and type of show.
Column Comment.22: SHOW LENGTH OUOM: Show length original unit of measure.
Column Comment.23: SHOW TYPE: This column identifies the appearance of the hydrocarbons in theobject being evaluated. For example, show types can include Asphaltic stain,Bleeding gas, Oil fluorescence,...
Column Comment.24: TOP DEPTH: Measured depth from the surface to the top of the described interval.
Column Comment.25: TOP DEPTH OUOM: Top measured depth original unit of measure.
Column Comment.26: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.27: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.28: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.29: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.30: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.31: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.32: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
